Key ties: The–The (other), God–The (other), Fyodor–Jesus (worship), Jesus–Crowd (Other), +17 more

story_summary: Ivan recounts a poem about a mysterious visit of Jesus during the Spanish Inquisition, where Jesus silently witnesses the suffering and is arrested by the Grand Inquisitor. The Grand Inquisitor confronts Jesus, accusing Him of hindering the Church's authority and the suppression of human freedom for the sake of order and happiness, but Jesus responds only with a silent kiss. After the poem, Ivan and Alyosha discuss its meaning and their differing beliefs, ending with Ivan declaring his intention to leave and Alyosha rushing to visit the dying Pater Seraphicus.
evidence_quotes: ‘Go, and come no more ... come not at all, never, never!’
‘I meant to end it like this. When the Inquisitor ceased speaking...’
